Module org.example._50zo
Package Controller

Class FinalMessageController

java.lang.Object
Controller.FinalMessageController
public class FinalMessageController extends Object
Controller class responsible for managing the final winner dialog displayed at the end of a match. This controller handles UI updates, winner message configuration, and interaction logic such as closing or resuming the game.

The controller receives references to the players, turn manager, and supporting UI elements. Once all required data is set, the method setWiner() must be called to properly display the winner text.

This class is used together with the ShowWiner UI window.

Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • FinalMessageController

      public FinalMessageController()
      Default constructor. Initializes a new instance of the controller.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller after its FXML components are loaded.

      No winner data is set here because required game information is not yet available at this point. All winner-related logic must be invoked manually once dependencies are injected.

    • setTurnManager

      public void setTurnManager(TurnManager turnManager)
      Sets the turn manager used to determine the winner.
      Parameters:
      turnManager - the TurnManager instance

    • setHumanPlayer

      public void setHumanPlayer(PlayerHuman humanPlayer)
      Sets the human player reference.
      Parameters:
      humanPlayer - the PlayerHuman instance

    • setPlayerGPUList

      public void setPlayerGPUList(List<PlayerGPU> playerGPUList)
      Sets the list of GPU players used for identifying the winner.
      Parameters:
      playerGPUList - the list of PlayerGPU instances

    • setMessages

      public void setMessages(ShowWiner showWiner)
      Sets the ShowWiner window managed by this controller.
      Parameters:
      showWiner - the window instance displaying the winner

    • setWiner

      public void setWiner()
      Configures and displays the text that indicates which player won the game.

      This method MUST be called after all required game data (TurnManager, humanPlayer, GPU list) have been assigned.
